intro: Euphrasia nervata, commonly known as the slender eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glandular surface. Euphrasia nervata is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye conditions and inflammatory disorders.
